name: Generate Research Ideas from PDF Documents based on Content Gaps

parameters.content:
## Optional: Better PDF Conversion

### Standard Map PDF to Text node will split your PDF files into very short chunks, which deteriorates retrieval. 

Use can use [ConvertAPI](https://convertapi.com?ref=4l54n) which is a high-quality convertor that will respect the layout of the original document and not cut the paragraphs into short chunks. 

Here is an HTTP node that makes a request to their API to convert the PDF into text. If you have a ConvertAPI account, you can replace the "Extract Text from PDF" node in Step 3 with this node. 

Note that you will need to map the text output from this node correctly in the Step 4 after.

parameters.content:
## Step 1: User uploads the PDF files for analysis

### You can expose this endpoint and make it publicly available via a URL to your organization.

## Step 2: Convert uploaded binaries into PDF files

### We need to convert the binaries uploaded to the PDF files so we can extract text from them.

## Step 3: Extract plain text from PDF files

### For better quality text extraction, you can use the optional [ConvertAPI](https://convertapi.com?ref=4l54n) node to the right, which respects the files' original formatting.

## Step 4: Combine extracted text into a text string

### Prepare data for InfraNodus: combine all the extracted text into a text string and also tell InfraNodus the gap depth it should use when generating advice

## Step 5: Use InfraNodus GraphRAG to build a knowledge graph, find the gap, and generate a research question based on it.

### [InfraNodus](https://infranodus.com) builds a knowledge graph from all the texts, identifies the topical clusters that are least connected, and generates a research question that has a potential to bridge them in a new way.

ðŸš¨ PROVIDE YOUR INFRANODUS API KEY HERE

## Step 7: Show question / prompt to the user

### Optionally, you can feed the response to your other n8n workflow or expose it via a webhook and show it in your own app using an iframe.

# How does InfraNodus GraphRAG generate research questions?

## [InfraNodus](https://infranodus.com) GraphRAG helps avoid generic responses and LLM bias through analyzing your text's structure. Here's how it works:

### 1. It represents your text as a network of concepts and relations building a knowledge graph.

### 2. It then identifies the clusters of cocnepts that are furthest apart from each other â€” they appear in the same context (your texts) but are not well connected.

### 3. InfraNodus will then use the AI to generate a question / prompt that bridges this gap â€” touching upon relevant topics but connecting them in a new way.

![structural gap infranodus](https://infranodus.com/images/front/infranodus-structural-gaps-ideas.jpg)

## Step 6: Generate a Response using InfraNodus GraphRAG API

### Use the gap question generated by [InfraNodus](https://infranodus.com) in the previous step to generate an idea based on your PDF documents

ðŸš¨ PROVIDE YOUR INFRANODUS API KEY HERE

## Optional: Get the answers from a different collection of papers

### You can use a different collection of PDFs to generate an answer, which can be especially good for cross-disciplinary research.

Simply use a different set of PDFs here and add their text output to the `text` field of the InfraNodus HTTP node.

You can also use an existing InfraNodus "expert" graph that you save in the system to derive answers for your queries.
